statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Tulane 75, Charleston Southern 69
article.story: NEW ORLEANS (AP) -- Chris Moore led four Tulane players into double figures with a team-high 17 points and the Green Wave held off a late charge by Charleston Southern for a 75-69 victory on Saturday. Tulane (2-1) started the game with a 20-4 run and led by as many as 17 points on two occasions, including 27-10 with 7:10 remaining in the opening period. But Charleston Southern (2-2) began to chip away at the deficit when V.J. Fails sparked a 14-1 run with a layup at the 3:19 mark as the Buccaneers clawed their way back to within five points. Moore silenced the run with a 3-pointer and Donnie Stith hit 1-of-2 free throws to increase the Green Wave lead to nine points. Charleston Southern hit three baskets in the final two minutes and trailed the Green Wave 35-30 at the break. Tulane opened the second period with four straight buckets, including a 3-point shot by Moore and consecutive dunks by Stith and David Gomez, who finished with 12 points in 14 minutes. TU led 44-30 before Charleston Southern's Dwayne Jackson answered with a jumper at the 16:12 mark. Tulane built another double-digit lead, but Charleston Southern's Chris Moore rattled off back-to-back treys to pull his team to within seven points. The two teams traded baskets before Giedrius Knysas scored six straight points to move the Buccaneers to within striking distance, 52-48. Minutes later, Knysas scored five more and Tulane was clinging to a one-point lead with 7:14 remaining in the game. In the fourth, a pair of free throws by Jackson with 33 seconds remaining pulled Charleston Southern to within three points. Following a free throw by Tulane's Moore, Donnell Covington misfired on a three-point attempt and Moore grabbed the rebound and was immediately fouled. He converted his free throws and the Wave held on for the victory. Charleston Southern's Chris Moore led all scorers with 20 points and eight rebounds in the loss.
